key_points: Virginia's gubernatorial race between Republican Glenn Youngkin and Democrat Terry McAuliffe is viewed as a national bellwether.
Youngkin has received an endorsement from former President Donald Trump but maintains a careful distance.
The campaign has focused heavily on cultural issues, particularly regarding education.
The race is extremely close, with FiveThirtyEight giving Youngkin a slight lead the day before the election.
Both candidates spent the final weekend before the election campaigning heavily across the state.
Loudoun County is highlighted as a critical area for both campaigns, emblematic of broader national cultural battles.
McAuliffe's campaign experienced a tense moment with a Youngkin supporter in Loudoun County.
The outcome of the Virginia governor's race is seen as indicative of the political climate leading into the 2022 midterms.
Despite Youngkin's lead, McAuliffe is expected to win in Loudoun County, though analysts are watching Youngkin's performance there closely.
The race has sparked intense feelings and concerns over potential confrontations between opposing supporters.
spokespersons: Terry McAuliffe (Democratic candidate and former governor)
